How to Install kdiamond on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • kdiamond

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install kdiamond on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing kdiamond on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall kdiamond in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install kdiamond, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install kdiamond Using apt

To install kdiamond in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install kdiamond using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install kdiamond

The installation of kdiamond might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install kdiamond Using apt-get

To install kdiamond using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install kdiamond.

sudo apt-get -y install kdiamond

Install kdiamond Using Synaptic

To install kdiamond using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install kdiamond on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for kdiamond. This will display the kdiamond package in the package window, now to install kdiamond, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the kdiamond package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of kdiamond.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install kdiamond Using aptitude

To install kdiamond on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of kdiamond.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install kdiamond using the command aptitude install kdiamond.

sudo aptitude -y install kdiamond

How to Upgrade kdiamond on debian

If you want to upgrade the kdiamond package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade kdiamond using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade kdiamond to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade kdiamond.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade kdiamond sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade kdiamond

Upgrade kdiamond using Aptitude

To upgrade kdiamond using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade kdiamond.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade kdiamond

Upgrade kdiamond using Synaptic

To upgrade kdiamond using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for kdiamond, now right-click kdiamond, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade kdiamond just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall kdiamond on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall kdiamond from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just kdiamond, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove kdiamond

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of kdiamond

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of kdiamond you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge kdiamond

Remove kdiamond using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall kdiamond using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for kdiamond, right-click the kdiamond package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall kdiamond click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install kdiamond on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade kdiamond using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of kdiamond then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
